answer.content: {"sections": [{"spans": [{"text": "First, I want to check the dictionary to make sure I\u2019m using \u201cinstitutional racism\u201d correctly:", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "plain", "is_rtl": false}, {"spans": [{"text": "", "modifiers": {"image": "https://qph.fs.quoracdn.net/main-qimg-99ccdf80801808b1e8f9578d501bd8f5.webp", "height": 305, "width": 563, "master_url": "https://qph.fs.quoracdn.net/main-qimg-99ccdf80801808b1e8f9578d501bd8f5", "zoomable": true}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "image", "is_rtl": false}, {"spans": [{"text": "Ok. In that case, my answer fits the definition perfectly:", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "plain", "is_rtl": false}, {"spans": [{"text": "The best public high schools in Chicago are called \u201cselective enrollment\u201d schools, because they do exactly that\u2026 selectively enroll students on a point system. Students are divided into four \u201ctiers\u201d based on the average income of the people on their block. The selective enrollment schools only take a certain number of students from each tier. Here is a map of the \u201ctiers.\u201d", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "plain", "is_rtl": false}, {"spans": [{"text": "", "modifiers": {"image": "https://qph.fs.quoracdn.net/main-qimg-9461161bb324a0559b998b09b5ecc535.webp", "height": 624, "width": 491, "master_url": "https://qph.fs.quoracdn.net/main-qimg-9461161bb324a0559b998b09b5ecc535", "zoomable": true}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "image", "is_rtl": false}, {"spans": [{"text": "The green areas of the map are \u201ctier 4\u201d neighborhoods. The red areas are \u201ctier 1\u201d neighborhoods.", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "plain", "is_rtl": false}, {"spans": [{"text": "Here are the scores needed to get into one of the best selective enrollment high schools in Chicago:", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "plain", "is_rtl": false}, {"spans": [{"text": "", "modifiers": {"image": "https://qph.fs.quoracdn.net/main-qimg-a3ecbede4d5ee122ab8fbb1ec3bc166f.webp", "height": 374, "width": 735, "master_url": "https://qph.fs.quoracdn.net/main-qimg-7b6deb183bee94fb6a57886bc02472d6", "zoomable": true}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "image", "is_rtl": false}, {"spans": [{"text": "A 900 is the best possible score. A student from a tier 4 neighborhood had to score 889 out of 900 to get into this school, but a student from a tier 1 neighborhood only had to score an 816 to get in.", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "plain", "is_rtl": false}, {"spans": [{"text": "So that\u2019s the \u201cinstitutional\u201d part. Now let\u2019s look at the \u201cracism\u201d part. Here\u2019s a map of Chicago demographics:", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "plain", "is_rtl": false}, {"spans": [{"text": "", "modifiers": {"image": "https://qph.fs.quoracdn.net/main-qimg-cd7d261a50165b7a8fbb3a8afc985a23.webp", "height": 1062, "width": 1164, "master_url": "https://qph.fs.quoracdn.net/main-qimg-6e4fc8f861552cb407af59aafc4f128b", "zoomable": true}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "image", "is_rtl": false}, {"spans": [{"text": "If you were to overlay those two maps, you\u2019d see an almost perfect correlation between CPS tier ranking and predominant race on the block.", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "plain", "is_rtl": false}, {"spans": [{"text": "That\u2019s an institution (Chicago Public Schools) using a metric to judge students that is de facto race-based. That is institutional racism.", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "plain", "is_rtl": false}, {"spans": [{"text": "Before the tier system was established, it actually was completely based on race. But they got sued and changed it to \u201csocio-economic status\u201d which, in Chicago, aligns heavily with race.", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "plain", "is_rtl": false}, {"spans": [{"text": "Yes, I know, the reason socio-economic status aligns with race in Chicago is because of generations of institutional racism in the past. The city is using this new institutional racism to try and correct the institutional racism of the past. I get it. I\u2019m not even saying it\u2019s wrong. I know why they do it. I\u2019m just saying that it\u2019s a textbook example of institutional racism: an organization that treats people from different races differently, and it\u2019s considered normal and rarely questioned.", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "plain", "is_rtl": false}]}
